meanings.definition: A general rule intended to regulate behavior or thought.
meanings.sent1: Following the precepts of kindness and honesty can lead to a happy life.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often teach important precepts to help students understand right from wrong.
meanings.sent3: The precepts of sharing toys and taking turns are crucial for preschoolers.
meanings.sent4: The precepts of good sportsmanship are like a compass guiding us through competition.
meanings.sent5: Learning the precepts of math can help us solve problems more easily.

meanings.definition: A command or principle intended especially as a general rule of action.
meanings.sent1: The precepts of the company require all employees to arrive on time.
meanings.sent2: In martial arts, students must follow the precepts of discipline and respect.
meanings.sent3: The precepts of eating vegetables before dessert were met with groans from the kids.
meanings.sent4: The precepts of teamwork are like the gears in a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The precepts of safety should always be followed when handling dangerous equipment.
